item.title: about me
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: Hi, I'm Zach! I do science and solve problems at Vanderbilt University in Nashville, TN. I’m currently a graduate student researcher in VISE MedICL applying ML to medical and neuroscientific data – mainly brain MRI, endoscopic feeds, fMRI, and EEG. I’m also interested in dimensionality reduction, control theory, optimization, and robotics. Check out my projects to see what I’m working on! I graduated from Vandy in May 2021 with a B.
item.content:encoded: Hi, I'm Zach! I do science and solve problems at Vanderbilt University in Nashville, TN. I&rsquo;m currently a graduate student researcher in VISE MedICL applying ML to medical and neuroscientific data &ndash; mainly brain MRI, endoscopic feeds, fMRI, and EEG. I&rsquo;m also interested in dimensionality reduction, control theory, optimization, and robotics. Check out my projects to see what I&rsquo;m working on! I graduated from Vandy in May 2021 with a B.S. in computer science and neuroscience, minoring in applied math. I expect to complete my masters in computer science from Vandy in May 2022. My hometown is Austin, TX. Outside of research, I enjoy heavy weights, friendship, hendiadys, esports, kombucha, haiku, cucumber cocktails, and shirtless runs through your neighborhood. Occasionally, I take a good photo. I am always open to new opportunities, especially those that align with my interests. You can contact me at zachary.a.stoebner@vanderbilt.edu. GitHub LinkedIn
